sentences.en: A biometric fingerprint reader keeps your files safe from prying ears.
sentences.cn: 指纹识别可以保证文档的安全.

sentences.en: He doesn't want his neighbours prying into his affairs.
sentences.cn: 他不喜欢邻居们窥探他的私事.

sentences.en: I'm sick of you prying into my personal life!
sentences.cn: 我讨厌你刺探我的私生活！

sentences.en: Imelda might think she was prying.
sentences.cn: 艾美达可能认为她在刺探别人的隐私。

sentences.en: No one would be prying round on a day like this.
sentences.cn: 在这样的日子肯定不会有人在附近窥探.

sentences.en: Please stop prying into my private life. Remember, curiosity killed the cat.
sentences.cn: 请别再打听我的私生活. 别忘了, 好奇招来麻烦.

sentences.en: Robert Daffin stays busy prying open the shellfish to serve customers.
sentences.cn: 达夫因一直忙于为顾客提供剖开牡蛎的服务.

sentences.en: She is always prying into other people's affairs.
sentences.cn: 她总是打听别人的私事.

sentences.en: She thought she was safe from prying eyes and could do as she wished.
sentences.cn: 她觉得自己不会被偷窥，可以随心所欲。

sentences.en: She went prying about into the corners of the hall.
sentences.cn: 她到大厅的各个角落去仔细的窥探.
别在屋子里到处窥探了.

sentences.en: There you go again, prying into other people's affairs!
sentences.cn: 你又来探听人家的事了!

sentences.en: Thou mayest cover up thy secret from the prying multitude.
sentences.cn: 你可以对那些刨根问底的群众隐藏你的秘密.

sentences.en: You bloody snooper! All the time you've been talking to me you've been prying into my family.
sentences.cn: 你这个包打听的无耻小人！你一直跟我喋喋不休，就是为了刺探我的家庭隐私！

sentences.en: You should stop prying; you know, it's unlawful to read other people's letters!
sentences.cn: 不要再窥探别人的私事了, 你知道, 偷看别人的信件是非法的!

trans.tran_cn: 打听，刺探（他人的私事）( pry的现在分词 )，撬开
